paragraphs.text:
%md
![MovieStream Logo](https://oracle.github.io/learning-library/data-management-library/autonomous-database/shared/movie-stream-story/introduction/images/moviestream.jpeg)

%md ## MovieStream: Analytics across the OCI Data Platform ### Seemingly simple questions - and they can be if you have the right database and query engine #### Avoid falling off the complexity cliff with Autonomous Database and Oracle SQL Data is stored across storage tiers and in multiple formats. Autonomous Database is a converged database that allows a single table to capture data of different types (scalar, json, geocoded and more) - stored both in the database as well as in object storage. Combine 1) ADB's ability to shield users and applications from storage complexity and 2) the market's leading SQL capabilities - and you can get fast answers to tough questions from any application.

msg.data:
MovieStream: Analytics across the OCI Data Platform

Seemingly simple questions - and they can be if you have the right database and query engine

Avoid falling off the complexity cliff with Autonomous Database and Oracle SQL

Data is stored across storage tiers and in multiple formats. Autonomous Database is a converged database that allows a single table to capture data of different types (scalar, json, geocoded and more) - stored both in the database as well as in object storage. Combine 1) ADB's ability to shield users and applications from storage complexity and 2) the market's leading SQL capabilities - and you can get fast answers to tough questions from any application.

paragraphs.text: %md ## Let's take a look at sales data from our data warehouse We have contact information about all of our customers and can see sales by geography

msg.data:
Let's take a look at sales data from our data warehouse

We have contact information about all of our customers and can see sales by geography

paragraphs.title: Top Sales by City
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select c.city, round(sum(actual_price)) as sales
from customer_contact c, custsales s
where c.cust_id = s.cust_id
and c.country = 'United States'
group by c.city
order by 2 desc
fetch first 10 rows only;

paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * 
from customer_contact 
where rownum < 10;

paragraphs.text: %md ## How to better understand customer profiles ### Lake House Queries What data do we have in our lake house that would help us understand our customers? **Go to [Data Catalog](https://console.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/datacatalog) to find interesting data.** In our Data Lake, we have information about customer in the Landing Zone that has not yet been certified - but is still useful for analysis. Let's explore **customer demographic** and **customer segmentation** data sets.

msg.data:
How to better understand customer profiles

Lake House Queries

What data do we have in our lake house that would help us understand our customers?

Go to Data Catalog to find interesting data.

In our Data Lake, we have information about customer in the Landing Zone that has not yet been certified - but is still useful for analysis.
Let's explore customer demographic and customer segmentation data sets.

paragraphs.title: Access Data Catalog from Autonomous Database
paragraphs.text:
%sql
-- Make this a little easier to view the mappping
select a.folder_name, 
       a.display_name, 
       a.business_name, 
       a.description, 
       lower(d.oracle_schema_name) as oracle_schema_name, 
       lower(d.oracle_table_name) as oracle_table_name
from all_dcat_entities a, dcat_entities d
where a.data_asset_key = d.asset_key
and a.key = d.entity_key
and lower(a.description) like '%customer%'
order by 1,2;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Customer Demographics
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select * 
from dcat$obj_landing.customer_extension ce
where rownum < 100;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Customer Segmentation
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select cs.short_name as segment,
       count(*) as num_customers
from dcat$obj_landing.customer_segment cs,   -- from data lake
     dcat$obj_landing.customer_extension ce  -- from data lake    
where cs.segment_id = ce.segment_id
group by cs.short_name
;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Movie views by age range
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select
    case 
        when ce.age > 75 then 'Silent Generation'
        when ce.age between 57 and 75 then 'Boomer'
        when ce.age between 41 and 56 then 'Gen X'
        when ce.age between 25 and 40 then 'Millenials'
        when ce.age between 9 and 24 then 'Gen Z'
        end as age_range,
    count(*) as views
from dcat$obj_landing.customer_extension ce,   -- from data lake
     custsales c                               -- from data warehouse
where ce.cust_id = c.cust_id
group by 
    (case 
        when ce.age > 75 then 'Silent Generation'
        when ce.age between 57 and 75 then 'Boomer'
        when ce.age between 41 and 56 then 'Gen X'
        when ce.age between 25 and 40 then 'Millenials'
        when ce.age between 9 and 24 then 'Gen Z'
        end
    )

paragraphs.title: Let's combine the activity data in the Data Warehouse with demographic information from the Data Lake
paragraphs.text: %md ## Find most popular movies. Spatial analytics over JSON and tabular data Movies are in **JSON** format. This is a really flexible way to store data - but can be hard to understand. Oracle SQL makes it simple.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

msg.data:
Find most popular movies. Spatial analytics over JSON and tabular data

Movies are in JSON format. This is a really flexible way to store data - but can be hard to understand. Oracle SQL makes it simple.

paragraphs.title: Movies in JSON format
paragraphs.text:
%sql

select json_serialize(json_document) as doc
from movie m
where rownum < 10

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Oracle SQL makes JSON look familiar ----> use powerful json transforms
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select 
    j.json_document.movie_id,
    j.json_document.title,
    j.json_document.year,
    translate(j.json_document.genre, '["]', ' ') as genres
from movie j
where rownum < 10;

paragraphs.text: %md ## What movies are my neighbors watching? ### Use spatial analytics over tabular and JSON data

msg.data:
What movies are my neighbors watching?

Use spatial analytics over tabular and JSON data

paragraphs.title: Find the nearest neighbors
paragraphs.text:
%sql
SELECT 
    a.first_name,
    a.city,
    b.first_name as neighbor,
    b.city as neighbor_city,
    round( sdo_nn_distance(1), 1 ) distance_km
FROM customer_contact a, customer_contact  b
WHERE a.cust_id = 1059376 -- Roberta
and a.cust_id != b.cust_id
AND -- 20 nearest neighbors
    sdo_nn(
    latlon_to_geometry(b.loc_lat, b.loc_long),
    latlon_to_geometry(a.loc_lat, a.loc_long),
    'sdo_num_res=21 unit=KM',
    1 ) = 'TRUE'
order by 5

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: What are Roberta's neighbors watching?
paragraphs.text:
%sql
with neighbors as (
    SELECT 
        b.cust_id -- the neighbor
    FROM customer_contact a, customer_contact  b
    WHERE a.cust_id = 1059376
    and a.cust_id != b.cust_id
    AND sdo_nn(
        latlon_to_geometry(b.loc_lat, b.loc_long),
        latlon_to_geometry(a.loc_lat, a.loc_long),
        'sdo_num_res=20 unit=KM',
        1 ) = 'TRUE'
),
neighbors_movies as (
    select 
        movie_id,
        count(*) as popularity    
    from custsales c, neighbors n -- combine sales activity with neighbors' movies
    where c.cust_id = n.cust_id
    group by movie_id  
)
select
    j.json_document.movie_id,
    j.json_document.title,
    j.json_document.year,
    n.popularity,
    translate(j.json_document.genre, '["]', ' ') as genres,
    translate(j.json_document.awards, '["]', ' ') as awards    
from neighbors_movies n, movie j -- combine all the above!
where n.movie_id = j.json_document.movie_id
order by popularity desc nulls last
fetch first 10 rows only;

paragraphs.text: %md ## Publish the data set ### Simplify access for other users and applications * Create a summariezed sales dashboard materialized view over the sources * This will simplify access to the data and accelerate performance * Queries against the base tables can automatically rewrite to the MV for interactive analytics

msg.data:
Publish the data set

Simplify access for other users and applications

  • Create a summariezed sales dashboard materialized view over the sources
  • This will simplify access to the data and accelerate performance
  • Queries against the base tables can automatically rewrite to the MV for interactive analytics

paragraphs.title: Create sales dashboard data set
paragraphs.text:
%sql
CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW sales_dashboard
ENABLE QUERY REWRITE AS (
select
    cs.short_name as customer_segment,
    ce.education,
    ce.gender,
    ce.household_size,
    ce.job_type,
    ce.income_level,
    case 
        when ce.age > 75 then 'Silent Generation'
        when ce.age between 57 and 75 then 'Boomer'
        when ce.age between 41 and 56 then 'Gen X'
        when ce.age between 25 and 40 then 'Millenials'
        when ce.age between 9 and 24 then 'Gen Z'
        end as age_range,
    cc.country,
    cc.city,
    c.day_id,
    g.name genre,
    count(*) as views,
    sum(actual_price) as sales        
from dcat$obj_landing.customer_extension ce, custsales c, genre g, dcat$obj_landing.customer_segment cs, customer_contact cc
where ce.cust_id = c.cust_id
  and ce.cust_id = cc.cust_id
  and g.genre_id = c.genre_id
  and ce.segment_id = cs.segment_id
group by 
    cs.short_name,
    ce.education,
    ce.gender,
    ce.household_size,
    ce.job_type,
    ce.income_level,
    (case 
        when ce.age > 75 then 'Silent Generation'
        when ce.age between 57 and 75 then 'Boomer'
        when ce.age between 41 and 56 then 'Gen X'
        when ce.age between 25 and 40 then 'Millenials'
        when ce.age between 9 and 24 then 'Gen Z'
        end
    ),
        c.day_id,
        g.name,
    cc.country,
    cc.city
  );

paragraphs.title: Breakout movie views by age range
paragraphs.text:
%sql
select
    age_range,
    sum(views) as views
from sales_dashboard
group by age_range
